References¶

[1]M H P Bott. GRAVN. Durham geophysical computer specification, 1969.
[2]G D Garland. The Earth’s Shape and Gravity. Elsevier, 1965. ISBN 9780080108223. doi:10.1016/B978-0-08-010822-3.50011-X.
[3]C.A. Heiland. Geophysical Exploration. Geology series / edited by Norman E.A. Hinds. Prentice-Hall, Incorporated, 1940.
[4]P Kearey, M Brooks, and I Hill. An Introduction to Geophysical Exploration. Blackwell Publishing, 2013.
[5]S. Reford. Magnetic anomalies over thin sheets. Geophysics, XXIX(4):532–536, 1964. doi:10.1190/1.1439388.
[6]M Talwani and J. R. Heirtzler. Computation of magnetic anomalies caused by two dimensional bodies of arbitrary shape. In Computers in the mineral industries, Part 1, volume 9, pages 464–480. 1964.
[7]Manik Talwani, J. Lamar Worzel, and Mark Landisman. Rapid Gravity Computations for Two-Dimensional Bodies with Application to the Mendocino Submarine Fracture Zone. Journal of Geophysical Research, 64(1):49–59, 1959. doi:10.1029/JZ064i001p00049.
